place.name: CHEDZOY
place.gazetteerText: CHEDZOY, a parish in Bridgewater district, Somerset; near the Bristol and Exeter railway, 3 miles E by N of Bridgewater. It has a post office under Bridgewater. Acres, 1, 655. Real property, £4, 490. Pop., 442, Houses, 88. The property is divided among a few. Ancient coins and other relics have been found. Fairfax had his head-quarters here when besieging Bridgewater. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £480.* Patron, the Rev. G. O. Mullens. The church is old but good. Bishop Nikke and A. Pascal were rectors. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
